ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT:
A student wanted to design a mirror which can reflect all the light incident placed at an angle more than 45° and it should neglect the remainder rays of incidence.

Find the refractive index of mirror which should be used. (Given refractive index of chemical solution = 1.8)

In a Young’s double slit experiment a monochromatic laser beam is used to provide the coherent source. To emit the monochromatic laser beam electron has to jump through an energy band of energy difference 4.2 eV inside the laser. The wavelength of the laser beam emitted by the laser source is ___________
A light beam incident normally at a glass air interface. If the glass has refractive index of 1.33 and air has refractive index of 1 then the loss of intensity through reflection is
In a Young’s double slit experiment, what is the separation between two slits for which 610 nm orange light has its first maximum at an angle of 30°? (Answer in nm)

What is the light gathering capacity of optical fibre given its acceptance angle is

(Answer in percentage and round off upto two decimal places)
Find the relative refractive index difference of the fibre optic cable. Given its core refractive index is 1.3 and acceptance angle is 30°.

What is the maximum order of Bright fringes possible in a Young’s double slit experiment. If the distance between the slits is 2 μm and a light source of λ = 650 nm. Distance between slits and screen is given as 20 μm.

How many modes of transmission are possible a for a single mode fibre optic cable?
(Given: V = number = 2.405)

In the experiment of Young’s double slit, the distance between slits is 0.63 nm and the distance between the screen and slits is 20 μm. The Red light of 650 nm is used. Choose the correct options for Young’s double slits experiment.
ENGLISH.OPT1: The distance between only two successive bright or dark fringes is 20.64 mm.
ENGLISH.OPT2: Distance of 2nd bright fringe from the central position of optical screen is 41.27 mm.
ENGLISH.OPT3: Distance of 2nd dark fringe from the central position of optical screen is 41.27 mm.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT:
Consider a light ray travelling from glass (refractive index = 1.44) to air (refractive index = 1).
The angle of incidence at glass-air interface is 30°. If this interface is then dipped in water with refractive index of 1.33. The angle of refraction in air and the water respectively a

What is the fringe width of if the Young’s double slit experiment is carried out in water medium with refractive index of 1.33. Given distance between the slits is 20 μm. Distance between slits and screen is 200 μm and a light of 850 nm is used. (Answer in μm, round off upto two decimal places)

Light is made to travel in a dielectric medium having a refractive index of 1.20. If the velocity of light in vacuum is 3 × 105 km/sec. The time taken by the light to travel a distance of 100 km in the given dielectric medium is _______ msec.

A light beam is made to pass through two separate tissues A and B having refractive index 1.2 and 1.5 respectively. If the length of both the tissues are same and equal to 4 m. The ratio of time taken by the light beam travelling through the tissue B with respect to the tissue A is

When the mean optical power launched into an 100 km length of fiber is 200 μW, the mean optical power at the fiber output is 2 μW without any connector or splices, the overall signal attenuation for a 120 km optical link using the same fiber with splices at 10 km intervals (each giving an attenuation of 1 dB) is ________dB.

A step index optical fiber whose refractive indices of the core and cladding are 1.55 and 1.43 respectively, is surrounded by air. A double convex lens is used to couple a laser beam of diameter 10 mm into this optical fiber. The minimum focal length of the lens that should be used in order to focus the entire beam into the fiber is________mm.

In an experiment for determining the refractive index of gas using Michelson interferometer a shift of 200 fringes are observed, when all the gas is removed from the tube. If the wavelength of light used is and the length of the tube is 50 cm, then the refractive index of the gas is

The Michelson interferometer is dipped in water of refractive index 1.33 between such that only one mirror is inside it. The light source used is of wavelength 601 nm and distance between the splitter and mirror is 200 nm. Choose the correct options for the experiment.
